documents.document: Also I have other Marvel ships and I'm not afraid to use photoshop. (I do have a soft spot for T'Challa/Ororo, even if they aren't current)

I'm almost certain that Turnip is the kind of person you can condition until he ends up standing on one leg, quacking. Media, pls try this
There's a duck at my bus stop and it is rather placid and obviously wants some bread
Also can the neo-nazis just chill and get a hobby like cross-stitching or jigsaw puzzle solving rather than politics.
Also, could the mad scientists responsible for 2016 please focus on making their time machines work so they can fix their mistakes, thanks.
Death, can you maybe take 2017 off? Maybe take on a lighter load if you can't. You've been doing a lot of work this year, you deserve it.
I think there's at least 125ml of brandy and rum in it? It's moist enough it squelches when you cut it
The fruitcake and gingerbread ice cream that wasn't touched yesterday. Not pictured: how moist (and alcoholic) the… https://t.co/GHiQqzsryz
Catching up with @NightValeRadio & I forgot @jamesmoran co-wrote an ep. Yes, a deer face under a deer mask is totally something he'd write
I am wondering, with John Key's resignation, what will come to light after Christmas/in January that influenced his decision.
I'm not sure if I like being super-aware of that incoming earthquake rattle. #eqnz
@mommyandgracie Mommy, since I know you are concerned and care about child online safety, this might be something y… https://t.co/Db1u50uiF9
So anyone know why power is out in Stokes Valley/the Glen Road area? Power line down/getting repaired?
Nothing actually went wrong, just it could've gone very wrong if things had gotten shaky.
So it might not have been the best idea to make marshmallows (hot boiling syrup and very sticky) whilst aftershocks are going. Still did it
@I_Am_Artemis https://t.co/1dRSEp1QAx They are indeed coming from up and down the country
@RachelNBanfield The larger ones have been centered south of Auckland, however there have been small aftershocks all over the place.
Nope, a strong one from Kaikoura https://t.co/tfSX6Sgh3E
... I'm pretty sure those little waves were coming down from Taupo. #eqnz
@chateura I had my laptop open, which is handy because I had to open GMaps to figure out the distance.
@Armageddonexpo Aftershocks! Up and down the country!
@chateura so using the distance of approx 12km / 9 is 1.3km p/s, assuming it took about six seconds to compose: 12km / 16 is 0.8km p/s
@chateura yep, and it struck for me about 7-9 seconds after you sent that tweet. I'm sure there's some more #science in that too
@chateura I refreshed just in time to experience that 'twitter moves faster than an earthquake' phenomenon.
Oh gods, there are smaller quakes up and down the country now. https://t.co/OUm1zBMODU #eqnz
Nope, not my legs, that was definitely a little wobble of an aftershock. #eqnz
I think my legs have stopped wobbling now. Though I'm still keyed up and expecting shaking. #eqnz
That was a long and strong #eqnz. Set off the house alarm upstairs, but nothing worse than things knocked over.
@lily_marston I have three piercings on each ear. Plus I have one set of partially healed piercings & a mole on one ear. I know that feel.
@AnnieDubDub apparently red states have polls that close earlier and get counted quickest, so that's why a swathe of red down the center.
I am amazed at the data analysis that google sheets offers.
@ELEMENTARYStaff Bees or lock picking for me. Because I have at least good theoretical bases for those two.
@AnnieDubDub *offers virtual hugs and got chocolate*
@maureenjohnson sweet flavored butters are basically icing & shouldn't be called butter. This might make some mean cinnamon toast though
@davidfarrier @maureenjohnson has some excellent stories about it, since she grew up near it.
And I am kind of hoping that's what the emotional plot of it is. Because I am a sucker for kid fic, even if it is Charles & Logan.
I don't think the #Logan trailer was supposed to look like Charles & Logan fighting for custody of Laura, but that's what I'm seeing
Soy sauce? More delicious fementation. And then there's stuff like tofu which undergoes a chemical process.
I am amazed at the amount of food science that goes on in Asian food. Nata de coco? Gels because of a bacteria that produces cellulose.

@fadeaccompli I know there's the Walk to Mordor 'challenge' which just needs you track distance. Don't know if there's an app for it yet.
@chateura (also I've never read the dalemark quartet so.)
& poking fun at 'gritty' fantasy like GoT is always fun. (Plus it'd be nice for a series to be transparent about being a construct)
@chateura Mostly I want it because Westworld's premise seems to be about faux realities in the name of tourism.
So with Westworld and GoT, I really want DWJ's Derkholme series to be adapted. Fantasy tourism! Gryphons! Making fun of fantasy tropes!
@chateura When I was like 12 I tried planting some that were 7 years old, some sprouted (but then I killed off) but some never did.
@chateura depends on the types of seeds really. Hard seeds usually are pretty hardy, but fleshy or ones with husks, not so much.
I love there are Tamora Pierce fans who are going 'for the love of it, please someone option Tammy's books'.

@MarvelAUNZ best line from Civil War

@AnnieDubDub if you talk, retweet stuff about or like stuff talking about someone on twitter OR follow someone who does, it gets recommended
Creme pat is delicious and I would eat for dinner if I could.
This is more Freudian than I like, but given the stories from my dad how it fucks you up, it's not much of a stretch https://t.co/wTAhvfr3bO
Because I love spies but I also love dramatic bureaucracy, or at least bureaucracy that's fictional. And Manhattan does that spectacularly.
And while I love #AgentCarter's writers team, I wouldn't have minded at all if they had borrowed some of Manhattan's writing team.
Watching the TV series Manhattan and wow the emotional complexity of the writing. Particularly Lila Byock's episodes.
It delights me whenever someone calls me an evil genius when I cause emotional anguish. Sadly the evil genius job market is crap
thunder, rain and lightning, very very exciting
The recent little shakes Wellington's been receiving probably didn't help either
So my brain decided to interpret #Brexit as a literal nightmare, complete with large meteor hitting the earth and an eldritch creature
https://t.co/TcOoRMczPc I wish this had been around when I was studying for my learner's.
So rebut the idea that livetweeting a disaster is useless. 1) it can provide data, 2) doing so can help calm people so they can DO something
sending a GeoNet report still feels like you've helped and makes you feel calmer. Which is a good thing, even if the data isn't helpful.
Reflecting on the Geonet app: even if sending a report in does nothing except add more data to how distance impacts felt effects
Power cut means no WiFi for this night owl, but I do enjoy showering by torchlight.
OK, Pietro actually appeared in AoU & that probably took finagling, but I'm amused their legal situation is as complicated as their family.
and 2) Fox and Marvel literally had a custody ('rights') battle over the Maximoff twins and split them up so they both could have one.
X-men: Apocalypse made me realise two things: 1) Cyclops' battle strategy is to have a staring contest with whoever he's fighting
Hey @WhittakersNZ could you maybe look into having a device friendly/adaptable website? Clicking HTML version is very 2005
What does it take to inform the world, especially creatives, that you wear garter belts UNDER your underwear?
putting me in the minority who liked the twist. Even if I do agree that it's a shame there weren't any space dragons.
Because that and Maya's involvement would've been so interesting. Mind you I already defend the whole war profiteering plot
Predictably the thing I care most about the IM3 could've had a female villain news is would Pepper still have had a history with them?
I am very behind on listening to @NightValeRadio, but I was very happy to hear @KimBoekbinder as the weather for episode 83
@Alisonmau I bet these people complain about millennials too, yet hypocritically demand to retire using those 'lost' taxes.

Also it only focuses on large countries who have high power demands. Until small 4th gen reactors become viable small countries won't switch
Really like the glimpses of modern nuclear facilities though. They're all shiny and robotic!
Despite pointing out that micro/millisieverts of radiation aren't harmful, there so far hasn't been anything about the types of radiation
Emphasis on 'only'. Part of, I'm fine with. Because apparently no documentary can say maybe we should do all the things.
Not fond of the environmentalists are reactionary, irrational beasts narrative though. Not too fond either of the only solution is nuclear
It is interesting, going from 'yes, the future!' to 'the presence of nuclear plants alone is poison' to 'better than fossil fuels *shrug*'
Currently watching a documentary about nuclear power and its history. Please #RenewAgentCarter because I'd love to see that history explored
@donttrythis Hanna is one of my favorite movies. It's a fairytale movie that isn't; but is also a thriller, a sci-fi movie.
I just realised that Ashildr probably met Rani, Clyde, Luke, Maria and Skye at some point. Which makes me really happy.
